comment._content: Edward Julius Berwind (1848-1936), mining executive: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Julius_Berwind There's a Berwind, West Virginia, named for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berwind,_West_Virginia And Windber, PA, is also name for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windber,_Pennsylvania

comment._content: This appears to be Berwind's testimony before the Walsh Commission (Commission on Industrial Relations) at New York's City Hall on January 21, 1915. At the time, he was a coal and railroad magnate. Other pictures from the Commission hearings in New York are in the Bain collection: www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=walsh%20commis...
